description: Creating a sales tax exemption for equipment purchased by fire districts in rural counties.

original.text:
H-0231.1
HOUSE BILL 1047
State of Washington
69th Legislature
2025 Regular Session
ByRepresentatives Dent, Griffey, Low, Shavers, Eslick, Orcutt, Bronoske, Timmons, Rule, Nance, and Davis
Prefiled 12/11/24.Read first time 01/13/25.Referred to Committee on Finance.
AN ACT Relating to creating a sales tax exemption for equipment purchased by fire districts in rural counties; adding a new section to chapter 82.08 RCW; adding a new section to chapter 82.12 RCW; creating new sections; and providing an effective date.
BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF WASHINGTON:
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 1. The legislature finds that some fire districts, especially those in rural counties, bear disproportionate costs due to the expansive geographic area they must serve with a sparsely populated tax base. It is the intent of the legislature to reduce the costs for certain fire districts in rural counties by exempting their purchases of equipment from sales and use taxes.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 2. A new section is added to chapter 82.08 RCW to read as follows:
(1) The tax imposed by RCW 82.08.020 does not apply to the purchase of any item of equipment by an eligible fire district located in a rural county.
(2) In order to qualify for the exemption in this section, an eligible fire district must apply to the department for a certificate of exemption.
(3) The department must publish annually, by January 1st, a list of eligible fire districts that qualify for the exemption in this section.
(4) The definitions in this subsection apply throughout this section unless the context clearly requires otherwise.
(a) "Eligible fire district" means a fire district in which the population of the district for that year as estimated by the office of financial management does not exceed 10,000 persons.
(b) "Equipment" means fire and emergency medical apparatus and all other vehicles, machinery, and equipment necessary for the prevention and suppression of fires, the providing of emergency medical services, and the protection of life and property.
(c) "Rural county" has the same meaning as provided in RCW 82.14.370.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 3. A new section is added to chapter 82.12 RCW to read as follows:
(1) The tax imposed by RCW 82.12.020 does not apply to the use of any item of equipment that is purchased by an eligible fire district located in a rural county.
(2) The definitions in section 2 of this act apply to this section.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 4. RCW 82.32.805 and 82.32.808 do not apply to this act.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 5. This act applies to purchases and uses made on or after October 1, 2025.
NEW SECTION.  Sec. 6. This act takes effect October 1, 2025.
--- END ---

summary.text:
Purpose

The primary goal of this bill is to create a sales tax exemption for equipment purchased by fire districts in rural counties. The legislature recognizes that these fire districts face higher operational costs due to large service areas with low populations. By providing this exemption, the bill intends to alleviate some of the financial burden on these districts, enabling them to better serve their communities.

Key Provisions

Sales Tax Exemption

  • The sales tax under RCW 82.08.020 does not apply to any equipment purchased by eligible fire districts located in rural counties.
  • To qualify for the exemption, fire districts must apply to the department for a certificate of exemption.
  • An annual list of eligible fire districts must be published by the department by January 1st of each year.

Eligibility Criteria

  • An "eligible fire district" is defined as one with a population of 10,000 or less, as estimated by the office of financial management.
  • "Equipment" includes fire and emergency medical apparatus, vehicles, machinery, and other necessary tools for fire prevention, emergency medical services, and protection of life and property.
  • A "rural county" is defined as per RCW 82.14.370.

Use Tax Exemption

  • The use tax imposed by RCW 82.12.020 does not apply to equipment purchased by eligible fire districts in rural counties.

Applicability and Enforcement

  • The provisions of this act come into effect for purchases and uses made on or after October 1, 2025.
  • The act will take effect on October 1, 2025, and certain specific RCW sections (82.32.805 and 82.32.808) do not apply to this act.
